TopicTitle: Unable to transmit science from lab

Articles.Content:
After a few days away, I returned today to my humble orbital lab. With science full, I went to transmit.....no transmit button. I've checked through everything I can think of.  The cfg files look good. AND, I've transmitted before from the same station.  

***EDIT***  Went into sandbox mode and made a vehicle with every lab I have, ALL of them have the transmit button, including the one that is in orbit in the career mode.  So now I'm extra stumped. 

KSP: 1.1.2 (Win64) - Unity: 5.2.4f1 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit

Edited May 6, 2016 by Vipermp

I've never had this before but will point out the obvious things to check: Do you have an antenna? Do you have power? Is your lab crewed (not sure if this is necessary but worth mentioning)? Have you deactivated time warp? Are you sure you have science in there and not just data? That's all I can think of for now.

Power - check [even turned on infinite power]

Antenna - check [functions transmitting other data]

Crew - check.  Scientist is happy and performing research.  So, I'm at a loss.  And I've tested the exact same lab module and it's fully functional.  So not sure what's up with the one in orbit.

On 5/7/2016 at 10:51 AM, Vipermp said:

do you have timewarp off?
